messages.content: As a child I spent a lot of time in and out of hospital – the fantastic care I received then and throughout my life inspired me to become a doctor. I'm driven by a desire to help sick people get better. But during my six years as an NHS psychiatrist, it's become clear to me there is an imbalance at the heart of the way our NHS treats patients... The Liberal Democrats offer the brighter future my patients so deserve.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plan to put mental health on an equal footing with physical health, ensuring treatment is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Ring-fencing funding for mental health services.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: While successive Labour and Conservative governments...

issues.health: For far too long mental health has been put on the back-burner... ensuring treatment is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Ring-fencing funding for mental health services.

leaflet.personalStatement: As a child I spent a lot of time in and out of hospital – the fantastic care I received then and throughout my life inspired me to become a doctor. I'm driven by a desire to help sick people get better.

examples: P.S. Approximately 1 in 4 people will face a mental health issue in the UK.
the fantastic care I received then and throughout my life inspired me to become a doctor.
I'm driven by a desire to help sick people get better.
there is an imbalance at the heart of the way our NHS treats patients.
The Liberal Democrats offer the brighter future my patients so deserve.
I'm proud of our NHS and of the colleagues I work with, but we are sick and tired of being passed over and demoralised when it's our mental health department, which yet again faces cuts.
For far too long mental health has been put on the back-burner... ensuring treatment is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

personalStories.story: As a child I spent a lot of time in and out of hospital – the fantastic care I received then and throughout my life inspired me to become a doctor.

examples: While successive Labour and Conservative governments have routinely overlooked mental health, the Liberal Democrats have always been at the forefront of the campaign, championing the issue.
